item.title: Working with Covers, Titles, Logos, Copyright and Table of Contents
item.description: Cover or Title Page All documents have a cover or a title page. It contains the logo, the title of the document, and the release or publication month and year. This is shown in the following figure. Note: The cover or title page does not have a header or footer. Working with Logos All documents must contain a logo wherever applicable. These logos are designed in different sizes and their usage depends on how and where they are used in the document.

item.title: Indexes in Microsoft Word
item.description: Creating an Index Professional Indexers recommend using a variety of keywords and synonyms to create indexes. However, index entries are based on topic titles only. This is due to limited project times. Moreover, every released book has several ways in which readers can look up information of interest, including the tables of contents, keyword searches, and indexes. Few points to keep in mind while creating indexes are: Index entries should be in lower case, with the following exceptions: Proper nouns Acronyms and abbreviations Quotation marks appear before and after the words that you want to list in the index.
